com.jfoenix.effects

Class JFXDepthManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jfoenix.effects.JFXDepthManager

  • public class JFXDepthManager
extends Object
    it will create a shadow effect for a given node and a specified depth level. depth levels are {0,1,2,3,4,5}
    Since:
    2016-03-09
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Shadi Shaheen

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      JFXDepthManager() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static Node createMaterialNode(Node control, int level)
      this method will generate a new container node that prevent control transformation to be applied to the shadow effect (which makes it looks as a real shadow)
      static int getLevels() 
      static DropShadow getShadowAt(int level) 
      static void pop(Node control) 
      static void setDepth(Node control, int level)
      this method is used to add shadow effect to the node, however the shadow is not real ( gets affected with node transformations) use #createMaterialNode() instead to generate a real shadow

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • setDepth

        public static void setDepth(Node control,
                            int level)
        this method is used to add shadow effect to the node, however the shadow is not real ( gets affected with node transformations) use #createMaterialNode() instead to generate a real shadow

      • getShadowAt

        public static DropShadow getShadowAt(int level)

      • createMaterialNode

        public static Node createMaterialNode(Node control,
                                      int level)
        this method will generate a new container node that prevent control transformation to be applied to the shadow effect (which makes it looks as a real shadow)
